title: How the Arch Angel stole Live Events
content:
Summary:
I figured I'm well overdue for this.
Looking forward to the 2024 LHE season!
I <3 you Hackerone, & Community Team!
Description:
Code 7.42 KiB
1
2Every hacker on Hackerone liked Live Hacking a lot…  
3But ArchAngel who’d been to fifteen did NOT!  
4The Angel hated hacking! The whole live event season!  
5Now, please don’t ask why. No one quite knows the reason.
6
7It could be perhaps there’s a WAF he can’t thwart,  
8It could be perhaps the dupe window was too short,  
9But I think that the most likely reason of all,  
10May have been that the snack options were two sizes too small.
11
12Whatever the reason, dupe window or the snackers,  
13He dreaded an invite while HATING the hackers,  
14Staring at his monitor with a sour, bearded frown,  
15At all the hackers having fun in the live-event town.
16
17For he knew every hacker at the LHE venue,  
18Was busy ordering drinks from the happy hour menu,  
19“And they’re collabing on bugs!” He snarled with a sneer,  
20“Tomorrow is the event day, it’s practically here!”
21
22Then he growled, with his angelic fingers nervously drumming,  
23“I MUST find some way to stop bounties from coming!”  
24For Tomorrow, he knew, all the Customer girls and boys,  
25Would wake bright and early. They'd ready their employees!
26
27And then! Oh, the exploits! Oh, the exploits!  
28Exploits! Exploits! Exploits!  
29That's one thing he hated! The EXPLOITS!  
30EXPLOITS! EXPLOITS! EXPLOITS!
31
32Then the hackers young and old would sit and hunt bugs.  
33They’d find bugs, and find bugs, and find BUGS BUGS BUGS BUGS!  
34They’d find bugs for the customer, who’d give them some hugs,  
35Which is something that made the arch angel say “ugh!”
36
37And THEN they’d do something he liked least of all!  
38Every hacker at the live event, the tall and the small,  
39Would slam on the keyboard with their fingers jabbing,  
40They’d hack side by side, and the hackers would start collabing!
41
42They’d collab! And they’d collar! And they’d COLLAB COLLAB COLLAB!  
43And the more the Arch Angel thought of this Live Event Collab,  
44The more the Arch Angel thought, “their bugs I must grab!”  
45Why, for thirty-four years I’ve put up with it now!
46
47“I MUST stop the Live Event from starting! But HOW?”  
48Then he got an idea! An awful idea!  
49The Arch Angel got a wonderful AWFUL idea!  
50“I know just what to do!” The Angel said with fervent,
51
52As he put on his best Argentine accent  
53And he chuckled, “This is the ruse of the century!”  
54“Why with an accent and some stilts, I’ll look just like Ari!”  
55“All I need is some hair…” The Angel looked around.
56
57But since The Angel was bald, there was none to be found.  
58Did that stop the Arch Angel? No! The Angel simply said,  
59“If I can’t grow my own hair, I’ll steal some good hair instead!”  
60So he called up Nicole, and took out his shears,
61
62And glued on her locks, right above his ears.  
63Then he loaded some bags and some old empty sacks,  
64Onto a plane to go steal some uber leet hax.  
65The Arch Angel was giddy, as his plane landed down,
66
67And slunk from the airport in the live event town.  
68The venue was dark. He’d have so much success!  
69All the hackers were still barhopping and partying with Jess!  
70When he came to first room of swag he’d finesse.
71
72“This is stop number one,” the old Ari-fake hissed,  
73And he walked in the door, empty bags in his fist.  
74He tried to log into Twitch, a task very painful,  
75But if Ariel could do it, then so could the Angel.
76
77He got stuck only once, for a moment or two.  
78Then he restarted his laptop, his monitor blue.  
79And announced to the Twitch audience who was there for a show,  
80“These swag boxes,” he grinned, “are the first things to go!”
81
82Then he slithered and slunk, with a smile most unpleasant,  
83Around the whole room, and took every swag present!  
84T-shirts! Waterbottles! Stickers! Hoodies!  
85Custom Snowboards, and other long-awaited goodies!
86
87And he stuffed them in bags. Then the Arch Angel of gloom,  
88Set his eyes next on the triaging room.  
89He slunk into that room. He watched the scope call!  
90He peaked at the triage queue. His jaw started to fall!
91
92He darted out of that room as quick as a flash.  
93Why, the Angel was disgusted they’d make so much cash!  
94So he set to “NA” all the bugs that were Lows.  
95“And NOW!” Grinned the Angel, “I’ll mark the Crits as Infos!”
96
97And the Angel was closing reports without love  
98When he heard a small sound, like the coo of a dove.  
99He turned around fast, and looking quite irate,  
100Was ol Caitlin Allison, whom they call Cait the Great.
101
102The Angel had been caught by this astute Hackeronie,  
103Who he hoped wouldn’t see that he was just an Ari phony.  
104She stared at the Angel and said, “Ariel, why,”  
105“Why are you closing the bugs out? WHY?”
106
107But you know that old Angel was so smart and so slick,  
108He thought up a lie, and he thought it up quick!  
109“Why my sweet little Cait,” the fake Ariel lied,  
110“There’s a leaderboard change that Shlomie just tried.”
111
112“So I’m closing out TEST bugs, so don’t look so deflated”  
113“I’m just making sure that reputation gets updated.”  
114And his fib fooled the Cait. Then he patted her head,  
115And he bought her a cosmo and he sent her to bed.
116
117And when Cait the Great went to sleep with her booze,  
118He started closing again, he had no time to lose!  
119The last bug he closed, was a doozy from Chap,  
120Then he opened up the leaderboard for the event, the old sap.
121And with one press of a button, he shut down the whole app.  
122
123And the one little bug that he left still open,  
124Was a CSRF from Justin that no one had hope in.  
125Then he did the same thing to other program’s queues,
126Knowing that without bugs, the all the hackers would lose!  
127
128It was quarter past dawn… All the hackers still hung-over,  
129All the Hacker’s still asnooze, when his laptop he hunched over,  
130He packed it up with their swag! Their free drinks! Their Macs!
131Their Lenovos! Their chargers! Their stickers! Their snacks!  
132
133Three thousand feet up! Up the side of Mt Hood,  
134He planned to dump it off the mountain for good!  
135“PoohPooh to the Hackers!” He was fiendishly humming!
136“They’re finding out now that no live event is coming!”  
137
138“They’re just waking up! I know just what they’ll do!”  
139“Their mouths will hang open a minute or two,"
140"Then the Hackers at the Live Event will all cry BooHoo!”
141
142“That’s a noise,” grinned the Angel, “That I simply MUST hear!”  
143So he paused. And the Angel put a hand to his ear.  
144And he did hear a sound coming in through the Slack.  
145Was it the sound of hackers when they aren’t able to hack?!
146
147But the sound wasn’t sad! Why, this sound sounded merry!  
148It couldn’t be so! But it WAS merry! VERY!  
149He stared at the Live Event! The Angel popped his eyes!  
150Then he shook! What he saw was a shocking surprise!
151
152Every hacker at the Live Event, the tall and the small,  
153Was collaborating! Without any bounties at all!  
154He HADN’T stopped the Live Event from coming! IT CAME!  
155Somehow or other, it came just the same!
156
157And the Angel, with his angelic fingers tapping on his keyboard,  
158Stood puzzling and puzzling: “Why are Live Events so adored?!”  
159“It came without bounties! It came without hacks!”  
160“It came without waterbottles, shirts, or backpacks!”
161
162And he puzzled three hours, till his puzzler was sore.  
163Then the Angel thought of something he hadn’t before!  
164“Maybe Live Events,” he thought, “aren’t just about loot.”  
165“Maybe Live Events,” he thought “are about friends and customers to boot!”
166
167And what happened next? Well…at Hackerone they say,  
168That the Angel’s friend circle grew three sizes that day!  
169And the minute his heart didn’t feel quite so tight,  
170He whizzed with his load through the bright morning light,
171
172And re-opened the bugs, and gave out swag that was swell,  
173And he, HE HIMSELF, The Angel gave the first Show & Tell.
174
Impact
Merry Christmas & Happy New Year!
steps: The Arch Angel impersonates Ariel by using an Argentine accent, stilts, and stolen hair to disguise himself.
He logs into the Twitch stream for the live event, pretending to be part of the event organization.
The Arch Angel proceeds to steal all the swag boxes, including T-shirts, water bottles, stickers, hoodies, and custom snowboards.
He enters the triaging room, marks low-severity bugs as 'NA' and critical bugs as 'Info', effectively closing them without proper review.
The Arch Angel shuts down the entire event application, leaving only one CSRF bug open to disrupt the event.
He packs up all the stolen items and plans to dump them off Mt. Hood to prevent the event from proceeding.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves the Arch Angel exploiting the trust and impersonation of an event organizer (Ariel) to disrupt the live hacking event. By gaining unauthorized access, he manipulates the event's bug triage process, steals swag, and attempts to sabotage the event's success. The attack leverages social engineering, unauthorized access, and manipulation of event systems.
reason: This vulnerability involves multiple complex components: social engineering to impersonate a trusted figure, unauthorized access to event systems, manipulation of bug reports, and disruption of the event infrastructure. The attack requires understanding the event's workflow, the trust dynamics among participants, and the technical systems involved. The non-obvious interaction between social engineering and system manipulation adds to the complexity.
